title: Principles of Applications
description: Comprehensive study of applications with emphasis on theoretical foundations and practical applications.

title: Principles of Analysis
description: Interdisciplinary approach to analysis combining theoretical knowledge with practical problem-solving.

title: Workshop
description: In-depth analysis of workshop principles. Students will develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills.

title: Applications
description: Rigorous treatment of applications theory and applications with emphasis on research methodology.

title: Research
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of research. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.

title: Research
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of research. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.

title: Theory
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of theory. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.

title: Graduate Theory
description: Interdisciplinary approach to theory combining theoretical knowledge with practical problem-solving.
prerequisites: ENVS 338 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Special Topics in Analysis
description: Interdisciplinary approach to analysis combining theoretical knowledge with practical problem-solving.
prerequisites: ENVS 390 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Graduate Methods
description: Examination of key concepts and methodologies in methods. Includes hands-on experience and case studies.
prerequisites: ENVS 364 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Graduate Practice
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of practice. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.
prerequisites: ENVS 301 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Special Topics in Workshop
description: Rigorous treatment of workshop theory and applications with emphasis on research methodology.
prerequisites: ENVS 330 and senior standing or graduate status
